definition[2]: to make things into a neat pile, or to form a neat pile
example[2]: The assistants price the items and stack them on the shelves.
definition[3]: to put neat piles of things on something
example[4]: He went back to stacking the shelves.
example[5]: The floor was stacked with boxes.
definition[4]: a temporary store of information on a computer
definition[5]: to put things into neat piles
example[6]: The supermarkets failed to stack the shelves during opening hours.
definition[6]: to put a group of people, or vehicles or other things in a particular order as they wait to do something
example[7]: The two airliners were stacking as they waited to land.
